record.title: AUTHORITY FOR COMMITTEES TO MEET

speaking.topic: COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE, SCIENCE, AND TRANSPORTATION
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation be authorized to hold a hearing during the session of the Senate on Monday, April 30, 2007, at 2 p.m., in room 253 of the Russell Senate Office Building. The purpose of the hearing is to examine U.S. sanctions against Iran and the business dealings of American companies, including Halliburton, with Iran.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.topic: SUBCOMNIITTEE ON OVERSIGHT OF GOVERNMENT MANAGMENT, THE FEDERAL WORKFORCE, AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs' Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce and the District of Columbia be authorized to meet on Monday, April 30, 2007 at 2:30 p.m. for a Hearing entitled, The Federal Government's Role in Empowering Americans to Make Informed Financial Decisions.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
